alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the advisory area so far. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Downtown Charleston, James Island, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Charles Towne Landing, Charleston Naval Complex, James Island County Park and Maybank Bridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
